channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NJ
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NJ

item.title: Report I-2024100085
item.description:
Report I-2024100085

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-18T09:15:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-30
  • City: NEWARK
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED AIRLINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Customer heard a loud pop from his backpack that was stored underneath his seat . Customer discovered that his vape pen had exploded and was smoldering in the backpack . Fully boarded aircraft was deplaned as smoke was coming from the backpack . Law Enforcement, TSA, and the Fire Department arrived to aksess the event. Fire department personnel and authorities inspected the passenger's bag, confiscated the vape pen, and cleared the passenger of any security concerns. The item was placed in a Port Authority ARFF TCB for removal from the aircraft . There has been some social media activity related to this event . No aircraft damage or passenger injuries reported

item.title: Report I-2024100064
item.description:
Report I-2024100064

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-18T09:15:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-25
  • City: Elizabeth
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: DHL EXPRESS (USA), INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 09/25/2024 hidden dangerous goods were discovered during the shipment inspection process at the DHL El-Z Service Center, 15-31 Papetti Plaza, Elizabeth, NJ 07206. Transportation by road has been confirmed. Shipment also contains UN3481 Lithium ion batteries packed with equipment Class 9 Single Package or Inner Packaging(if any): Packaging Type: Case Material of Construction: Plastic Package Capacity: 82 g Amount in Package: 82 g Number in Shipment 1 Number Failed: 1

item.title: Report I-2024100084
item.description:
Report I-2024100084

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-18T06:17:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-06
  • City: NEWARK
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED AIRLINES HOLDINGS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Pax Devtosh Dubry came to the aft galley and told us his Iphone 14 was overheating. I felt the phone and it was very hot. He gave us the phone, (phone was turned off),we looked in the efoam. we followed instructions for the thermal containment bag. Placed the ped in the bag, sealed it and locked in the aft Iavatory. The captain and purser were informed. After passengers deplaned, the TCB was handed to the csr. 1

  • City: SADDLE BROOK
  • State: NJ

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDED TO AN AIR PACKAGE THAT WAS COLD TO THE TOUCH. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY 8 KGS OF DRY ICE COOLING MEDICATION. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM NEW JERSEY USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER X69862, BAXTER CARDINAL FROZEN DC CPAD, 500 NEELYTOWN RD, MONTGOMERY NY 12549-2828.

item.title: Report E-2024100342
item.description:
Report E-2024100342

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-16T09:16:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-20
  • City: CARLSTADT
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 02:26 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal XCV. It was reported that approximately 6-oz of Ethyl acetate released from a 30-gallon metal drum due to unknown reasons. The release impacted concrete dock floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site.

item.title: Report X-2024100598
item.description:
Report X-2024100598

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-12T21:13:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-01
  • City: SECAUCUS
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDED TO AN AIR PACKAGE THAT NEEDED TO BE REWRAPPED. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED ONE SMALL 15 ML BOTTLE OF FLAMMABLE DEBORAH LIPPMANN GEL LAB PRO TREATMENT FOR NAIL COLOR. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
